text: I should really continue with this series at some point. I loved the first trilogy and this game ended on such a perfect high note that it will feel weird to go back to more normal, standard cases. It's a pretty bad excuse though, I'll certainly play the rest at some point. This theme is aptly named and helps make some key moments even more memorable and emotional.
author: SupraDarky

text:
DO IT


Dual Destinies is freaking awesome, and I haven't finished it yet!
author: Cunningman45

text: @Cunningman45 Spirit of Justice is even better if you can believe it
author: Josh Walker

text: @Josh Walker Holy crap, really? Well I know what I'm spending my weekend doing!
author: Cunningman45

text:
@Cunningman45 Yea I thought it was, and while not necessary I'd also recommend each game's DLC case too

Dual Destinies has the better of the two but the one in Spirit of Justice is pretty great fanservice for those that played the original trilogy
author: Josh Walker

text: The best game they made after the original trilogy is AAI2, so make sure you don't skip it and play the fan-translation. :)
author: Phenom Uprising

text: Believe me Supra, the other games are as high quality as T&T (especially SoJ and AAI2), play them someday please.
author: Stocke

text: @Stocke I agree, AAI2 and SoJ are both amazing. AAI2 is probably my favorite AA game, followed by SoJ and then T&T. Too bad AAI2 was never released outside of Japan.
author: death-kuja

text: Also if you can, play the Investigations games, specially the second one, there are some translation patches out there, it's one of the best in the whole series
author: TyrannoBotti

text: couldn't agree any more. To me, phoenix's story ended with trials and tribulations
author: Firesnakex8

text: This game is so good. One of the best in the series, possibly even the best. I hope we get a return to Ace Attorney one day.

text: Dahlia downvoted this one.

text: The game where they do an exorcism in the courtroom... and there's still a half day left of trial to go AFTER that.
author: Chris Reaves

text: This trilogy is a goddamn masterpiece.
author: Konradix05

text: My favourite from the original trilogy, such a great game. But Gyakuten Kenji 2 is still superior for me, can`t believe I`m saying this.

text: ＬＡＳＥＲＦＡＣＥ

text: Brilliant soundtrack <3
author: Ahmed360

text:
Every time I play an AA game, it surprises me and surpasses the one before it. Dual Destinies blew me away with its final case and I'd honestly have a hard time picking out a favourite between T&T, AJ, and DD. 

Here's hoping SoJ is just as good or, dare I say it, better.
author: VentusxBBSxSpero

text: Personally speaking, Spirit of Justice is heartbreaking. One tier above Dual Destinies.
author: Levottomuus

text: So nostalgic. I used to play a LOT that kind of games on DS.
author: Guilherme

text: Weird..I just finished watching season 2 of the Ace Attorney anime. (Yes I’ve played the entire series incl Miles Edgeworth investigations!)
author: Bug Eye

text: How does it stack up? Did they eventually include the bonus episode of Phoenix 1 anywhere?
author: garfreeek

text: Ahh, so much delicious tragedy in this game. I love it.
author: Beremor

text: Such a moment this was. A defining gaming moment for me. I freaking love this series.
author: Darek Link

text: This part put something of a lump in my throat. All the stuff Godot did for Maya's sake, man... Damn the justice system. #FreeGodot
author: Cunningman45

text: Godot didn't realy do it for Maya's sake. As he said, if he was realy doing it for her, he would have told Phoenix. He cared about her, but he mainly did it for himself. He wanted to prove that he was capable of saving her himself. And he also wanted revenger. That's what makes him such a tragic character. He is not a bad guy, but he is definitely not entirely a good guy. He is a grey character.
author: death-kuja

text: @death-kuja Oh yeah, you're right. It's been a while since I played it, I forgot about that.
author: Cunningman45

text:
I guarantee you will looooove the 2nd trilogy. I know I did. :)
This game is definitely a tough act to follow, but I believe Dual Destinies manages to be just as good, if not better.
author: Medal Melodies

text: When you do get to the later games, you'll appreciate the huge jump in quality for the soundtracks, especially with Dual Destinies. It's one of my all time favorite VGM soundtracks.
author: TheTJWorks

text: T&T has a miles better soundtrack than that horrific, boring orchestral soundtrack
author: UneCleUSB

text: @UneCleUSB To each their own, I guess. No idea how you can think of DD as "horrific" or boring.
author: TheTJWorks

text: nice I was just listening to the soundtrack recently
author: Kakashi Hatake

text: The only time a lawyer can cry is when it’s all over.
author: Dalton McBleh

text: One of my favorites series of all time. I discovered PW on my DS and wow how hooked I was with every game, never played anything like it at the time, you could feel every case as if you were there.
